page.title: 20Church Lawford Aerodrome 2
page.content: This privately owned aerodrome was taken over by the RAF at the outbreak of the Second World War. The airfield was then used as a training station for new pilots particularly those from Australia,Canada and New Zealand.The most common type of aircraft found at the airfield was the'Oxford' a twin engined plane as indeed most of the aircraft here were. Other aircraft at the station included 'Tudors' and 'Ansons'.Many other aircraft used the station, though, as an emergency airfield most notably a 'Flying Fortress' which crashed there in August 1942 and a 'Wellington' bomber which crash landed there in April 1943.German prisoners of war were often used to clear any wreckage from crashed aircraft and there was much as pilots were new.The airfield was run down after the war and abandoned.
